alert.note: Alert for Johnston; Nash; Wayne; Wilson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 08 at 7:49PM EDT until July 08 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Johnston, Nash, Wayne and Wilson. * WHEN...Until 945 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 749 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Goldsboro, Smithfield, Wilson, Clayton, Fremont, Bailey, Micro, Selma, Four Oaks, Pine Level, Kenly, Princeton, Lucama, Middlesex, Black Creek, Pikeville, Sims, Buckhorn Reservoir, Emit and Flowers. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
